alert.note: Alert for Northern Gila County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 21 at 2:34PM MST until March 22 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: .Heavy rain continues to fall on a deep primed snowpack, leading to increased flows in waterways especially for lower elevation creeks and rivers. Flows in many rivers, creeks, and streams have increase quickly through today with some reaching critical levels. Additional rises in river, creek, and stream levels are expected. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible with some areas already experiencing flooding in Yavapai County and northern Gila County. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern Arizona including northern Gila County and Yavapai County. * WHEN...Through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding will be possible in creeks, normally dry washes, swimming holes and over recently burned areas. Low-water crossings could also experience flooding, which would create deadly travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Ample moisture and widespread, continuous rain and snow along the Mogollon Rim and southward have led to increased runoff. Waterways were already experiencing elevated flows. Rain on snow has also contributed to elevated flows and the risk of flooding. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
